examples.en: If your size is sold out, you can reorder when it’s back in stock.
examples.zh: 如果你的尺码卖完了，你可以在补货后再次下单。

extraExplanation: “re-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。所以“reorder”可以字面理解为“再次排序/再次订购”。
注意根据语境判断：在文件、列表、步骤、布局里多指“重新排列”；在购物、补货、供应场景里多指“再次下单/补订”。

summary.en: Reordered means arranged again into a different order (as a verb form or an adjective).
summary.zh: reordered 表示“重新排列成不同顺序”（可作动词的过去式/过去分词，也可作形容词）。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reorder) arranged again in a new order.
definition.zh: （reorder 的过去式/过去分词）重新排列；按新的顺序整理。

examples.en: The teacher reordered the worksheets by student number.
examples.zh: 老师按学生编号把练习册重新排序。

examples.en: After the update, the app menu was reordered to make it easier to use.
examples.zh: 更新后，应用菜单被重新排列，更容易使用。

definition.en: (adjective) put into a new order; rearranged.
definition.zh: （形容词）已重新排序的；已重新排列的。

examples.en: Please check the reordered list for any mistakes.
examples.zh: 请检查这份重新排序的名单有没有错误。

examples.en: She preferred the reordered paragraphs because the story felt clearer.
examples.zh: 她更喜欢重新排列后的段落，因为故事更清楚了。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，和“order（顺序；整理）”组合，reorder 就是“重新整理顺序”。在写作或数据处理中常见：reorder chapters/files/items。

summary.en: Reordering means either rearranging things into a new order or placing an order again.
summary.zh: Reordering 可指“重新排序/重排”，也可指“再次下单/重新订购”。

definition.en: the act or process of changing the order of things; rearranging
definition.zh: 重新排序；调换顺序（把事物按新的顺序排列）

examples.en: The app allows reordering of the playlist by dragging songs up or down.
examples.zh: 这个应用可以通过上下拖动歌曲来对播放列表重新排序。

examples.en: Reordering the steps made the instructions much easier to follow.
examples.zh: 把步骤重新排序后，说明更容易理解了。

definition.en: the act of placing an order again (buying the same item again)
definition.zh: 再次下单；重新订购（把同一商品再买一次）

examples.en: We’re reordering printer paper because we’re running low.
examples.zh: 我们快用完打印纸了，所以要再次下单。

examples.en: Reordering is simple—just click “Buy again.”
examples.zh: 重新订购很简单——点一下“再次购买”就行。

definition.en: moving items into a different sequence; changing their arrangement (often used as a verb form)
definition.zh: 重新排列；更改顺序（常作动词的 -ing 形式使用）

examples.en: I’m reordering the files so the newest ones appear first.
examples.zh: 我在重新排列文件，让最新的排在最前面。

examples.en: She spent the afternoon reordering her notes before the exam.
examples.zh: 她花了一下午在考试前把笔记重新整理排序。

extraExplanation: “reordering”既可以指“重新排序/重排”（更换顺序），也可以指“重新订购/再下单”（再次购买）。具体看语境：playlist / steps / files 多半是“重排”；paper / supplies / item 多半是“再订购”。
在写作里，表示“重新排序”时常见搭配有：reordering of + 名词（the reordering of priorities）。表示“重新订购”时常见搭配有：reordering + 物品（reordering ink cartridges）。

summary.en: “Reorders” means either rearranges something into a new order, or orders something again.
summary.zh: “reorders” 可指“重新排列顺序”，也可指“再次订购/重新下单”。

definition.en: to change the order of something; to arrange it again in a different sequence
definition.zh: 重新排列；把……按不同顺序再安排

examples.en: The teacher reorders the questions from easiest to hardest.
examples.zh: 老师把问题重新排序，从最简单到最难。

examples.en: The app reorders your photos by date automatically.
examples.zh: 这个应用会按日期自动重新排列你的照片。

definition.en: to order something again (for example, buying more of the same item)
definition.zh: 再次订购；重新下单（再买同样的东西）

examples.en: She reorders the same coffee beans every month.
examples.zh: 她每个月都会再次订购同一种咖啡豆。

examples.en: Our office reorders paper when supplies run low.
examples.zh: 办公室在纸张快用完时会重新下单采购。

extraExplanation: “reorders” 是动词 “reorder” 的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it reorders）。常见有两种意思：①“重新排列顺序”；②“再次订购”。具体含义要看语境（例如句子里出现 list/files/photos 多半是①；出现 goods/supplies/online 多半是②）。
构词上是 re-（再、重新）+ order（顺序/订购）。同一个词因为 order 既有“顺序”也有“订购”的意思，所以 reorder 也会有两类用法。

summary.en: Reordinate means to ordain someone again, especially in a church context; more rarely, it can mean to put something back into order.
summary.zh: Reordinate 通常指在教会语境中“再次按立/再授圣职”；较少见地也可指“重新整理、重新安排”。

definition.en: to ordain again (especially a priest or minister) or to confer holy orders a second time
definition.zh: （尤指对神职人员）再次授圣职、重新按立

examples.en: Some churches refuse to reordinate clergy who were ordained in another denomination.
examples.zh: 有些教会拒绝对在其他宗派已受按立的神职人员再次按立。

examples.en: After joining the new church, he was asked whether he needed to be reordinated.
examples.zh: 加入新教会后，有人问他是否需要重新按立。

definition.en: to arrange again or put back into order (rare; often replaced by ‘reorganize’)
definition.zh: 重新安排、重新整理（较少见；常用 reorganize 代替）

examples.en: They tried to reordinate the schedule to make room for the new class.
examples.zh: 他们试着重新调整日程，为新课程腾出时间。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，最常出现在宗教语境，指“再次按立/再授圣职”。在日常英语里，如果你想表达“重新整理/重新安排”，通常用 reorganize / rearrange / reschedule 更自然。
拼写上也容易让人联想到 coordinate（协调）或 ordination（按立）。如果你想说“重新协调”，更常用 re-coordinate（或 simply coordinate again）。

summary.en: Reordination means ordaining someone again, usually in a church setting.
summary.zh: Reordination 指在宗教（多为教会）语境中对某人进行再次按立/重新授予神职。

definition.en: the act of ordaining someone again, especially making a person (often a member of the clergy) officially a priest/minister for a second time
definition.zh: （尤指宗教领域）再度按立；重新授予神职/圣职（使某人再次被正式任命为牧师、神父等）

examples.en: Some churches require reordination if a minister transfers from a different denomination.
examples.zh: 有些教会要求牧师若从其他宗派转来，需要重新按立。

examples.en: The bishop refused the request for reordination.
examples.zh: 主教拒绝了重新按立的请求。

extraExplanation: “reordination”多见于基督宗派相关语境，讨论焦点常在于：不同教会/宗派是否承认彼此的按立有效性、是否需要“再次按立”。在日常英语中比较少用，学术或教会文件里更常见。
词形拆解：re-（再、重新）+ ordination（按立/任命）。在一些传统中，“ordination”带有强烈的宗教仪式与权威认可含义，因此“reordination”往往涉及教义与制度层面的争议。

summary.en: Reorganise means to arrange something again in a new, usually better, way.
summary.zh: reorganise 指把某事物重新安排或重组，通常是为了更好地运作。

definition.en: to change the structure or arrangement of something so it works better or differently; to put it in a new order
definition.zh: （为更好地运作或改变方式而）重组；重新安排；改组

examples.en: The company reorganised its sales team to focus on online customers.
examples.zh: 公司对销售团队进行了重组，以便更专注于线上客户。

examples.en: I reorganised my notes by topic before the exam.
examples.zh: 考试前我按主题重新整理了笔记。

definition.en: to organize yourself or your work again after a change or problem
definition.zh: （在变化或问题之后）重新组织/调整（自己的工作或计划）

examples.en: After the move, we needed a week to reorganise and settle in.
examples.zh: 搬家后，我们需要一周时间重新调整并安顿下来。

examples.en: Let’s reorganise and try a different plan.
examples.zh: 我们重新组织一下，换个计划试试。

extraExplanation: “reorganise”是英式拼写；美式更常用“reorganize”。两者意思相同。
常见名词形式：reorganization / reorganisation（重组；改组；重整）。在商业语境中常指公司结构、部门或流程的调整。

summary.en: “Reorganised” means something has been reorganized—its structure or arrangement has been changed to work better.
summary.zh: “reorganised”表示已经被重组或重新安排，即为了更高效而改变结构或布局。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “reorganise”: to change the structure or arrangement of something to make it work better
definition.zh: “reorganise”的过去式和过去分词：重新组织；调整结构或安排，使其更高效

examples.en: The company reorganised its sales team to improve customer service.
examples.zh: 公司重组了销售团队，以提升客户服务。

examples.en: After the merger, the departments were reorganised.
examples.zh: 合并之后，各部门进行了重组。

definition.en: rearranged or restructured
definition.zh: 已重新安排的；已重组的

examples.en: We moved faster with a reorganised schedule.
examples.zh: 在重新安排的日程下，我们推进得更快。

extraExplanation: “reorganised”是英式拼写（-ise）。美式英语更常写作“reorganized”（-ize），意思相同。
常见搭配：reorganised team/department/system/plan（重组的团队/部门/系统/计划）。语境多用于公司、政府机构、学校或项目管理等。

summary.en: Reorganiser means a person or tool that reorganizes something; it’s the British spelling of reorganizer.
summary.zh: reorganiser 指“重新组织/整理的人或工具”，是 reorganizer 的英式拼写。

definition.en: a person, tool, or thing that reorganizes something (puts it into a new, better order)
definition.zh: 重新组织者；改组工具/事物（把某物重新整理成更好的结构或顺序）

examples.en: The new manager became the main reorganiser of the department.
examples.zh: 新经理成了这个部门的主要改组者。

examples.en: This app works as a photo reorganiser and sorts pictures by date.
examples.zh: 这个应用可以当作照片整理工具，按日期把图片分类。

extraExplanation: “reorganiser”是英式拼写；美式更常写作“reorganizer”。两者意思相同。
词根拆分：re-（再次）+ organize（组织）+ -er（做……的人/物），所以整体就是“再次组织的人或工具”。

summary.en: Reorganising means arranging something again in a new or better structure; it can also mean the process of doing so.
summary.zh: reorganising 指把某事重新组织/调整成更好的结构；也可指这一过程。

definition.en: present participle of “reorganise/reorganize”: arranging something again in a new, more effective way (often a system, team, or company).
definition.zh: “reorganise/reorganize”的现在分词：对某事物进行重新组织/调整，使其更有条理或更有效（常指系统、团队或公司）。

examples.en: The company is reorganising its sales team to focus on online customers.
examples.zh: 公司正在重组销售团队，把重点放在网购客户上。

examples.en: We’re reorganising the schedule so everyone gets a fair break.
examples.zh: 我们正在调整日程安排，让每个人都能公平休息。

examples.en: She spent the weekend reorganising her notes for the exam.
examples.zh: 她周末用来重新整理考试笔记。

definition.en: (as a noun/gerund) the act or process of reorganising.
definition.zh: （作名词/动名词）重新组织/重整的行为或过程。

examples.en: Reorganising takes time, but it can make work much smoother.
examples.zh: 重组需要时间，但它能让工作更顺畅。

examples.en: After the reorganising, communication improved a lot.
examples.zh: 重整之后，沟通改善了很多。

extraExplanation: “reorganising”是英式拼写；美式通常写作“reorganizing”。两者意思相同。
在职场语境里，它常带有“结构调整/部门重组/流程再设计”的含义，有时也会让人联想到公司裁员或职责变化，但不一定总是负面。

summary.en: Reorganization means arranging something again in a new way, especially changing a company’s structure to work better.
summary.zh: reorganization 指重新组织/调整安排；也常指公司或机构的结构性“重组”，以提升效率或表现。

definition.en: The act or process of organizing something again in a new way to improve how it works.
definition.zh: 把某事物重新组织、重新安排（通常为了让它更有效）。

examples.en: The reorganization of the library made it easier to find books.
examples.zh: 图书馆的重新整理让找书更容易了。

examples.en: After the move, we did a full reorganization of the kitchen shelves.
examples.zh: 搬家后，我们把厨房架子彻底重新整理了一遍。

definition.en: A change in the structure of a company or institution (such as departments, roles, or leadership), often to reduce costs or improve performance.
definition.zh: （公司/机构的）重组；改组（如部门、岗位或管理层的调整，常为降本增效）。

examples.en: The company announced a reorganization to streamline operations.
examples.zh: 公司宣布重组以精简运营。

examples.en: Many employees were reassigned during the reorganization.
examples.zh: 在重组期间，许多员工被重新分配岗位。

examples.en: The merger led to a major reorganization of the two teams.
examples.zh: 合并导致两个团队进行了大规模重组。

extraExplanation: “reorganization”常用于商业与管理语境，含义比普通的“reorganizing”更正式，常暗示组织结构、权责或流程的系统性调整。
拼写上美式更常见“reorganization”，英式有时也写“re-organisation / reorganization”；是否加连字符（re-）通常取决于风格指南与排版习惯。

summary.en: “Reorganizational” means related to reorganization—changing how an organization is structured or run.
summary.zh: “reorganizational”意为“与重组/重新组织有关的”，指改变组织结构或运作方式。

definition.en: Related to reorganizing something—changing its structure, roles, or systems to work better.
definition.zh: 与“重组/重新组织”有关的——改变结构、角色或制度以更好地运作。

examples.en: The company announced a reorganizational plan to reduce costs and speed up decision-making.
examples.zh: 公司宣布了一项重组计划，以降低成本并加快决策速度。

examples.en: After the merger, there were reorganizational changes in several departments.
examples.zh: 合并之后，多个部门出现了重组性的变化。

extraExplanation: “reorganizational”常见于商业、管理、政府等正式语境，表示“与重组相关的”。在日常口语里，人们更常说“reorganization”或直接说“organizational changes / restructuring”。
常见搭配：reorganizational plan（重组计划）、reorganizational changes（重组性变动）、reorganizational effort（重组工作/努力）。
相关近义表达：restructuring（重组/改组，尤其公司结构）、organizational（组织的）、administrative（行政的）。其中“restructuring”在企业语境里更常用、更自然。

summary.en: A reorganizationist is someone who advocates reorganizing or restructuring a system or organization.
summary.zh: reorganizationist 指主张对某个组织或制度进行重组/重构的人。

definition.en: a person who supports or calls for reorganizing an organization, system, or institution (such as a company, government, or political party)
definition.zh: 主张（或支持）对组织、制度或机构（如公司、政府、政党）进行重组的人

examples.en: The reorganizationists argued that the company needed fewer departments and clearer roles.
examples.zh: 这些重组派认为公司需要更少的部门和更清晰的分工。

examples.en: In the debate, reorganizationists pushed for a complete rewrite of the party’s rules.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，重组派主张彻底改写党的章程。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里很少见，更常见的说法是 reformer（改革者）、restructuring advocate（主张重组的人）、change agent（变革推动者）。
构词可以拆开理解：re-（再次）+ organize（组织）+ -ation（名词后缀）+ -ist（“……主义者/支持者”）。
语境上常出现在政治史或组织管理讨论中，用来强调“不是小修小补，而是结构性调整/重建”的立场。

summary.en: “Reorganizations” means multiple changes or rounds of restructuring—organizing something again in a new way, often in companies or institutions.
summary.zh: “reorganizations”指多次重组/改组，即把组织或系统重新安排成新的结构，常用于公司或机构语境。

definition.en: Changes to the structure of something (such as a company, team, or system) to make it work better; the act of organizing again in a new way.
definition.zh: 对某事物（如公司、团队或系统）的结构进行调整以改善运作；重新组织、改组。

examples.en: The company announced several reorganizations after the merger.
examples.zh: 合并后，公司宣布进行了几次重组。

examples.en: These reorganizations are meant to cut costs and speed up decision-making.
examples.zh: 这些重组旨在降低成本并加快决策速度。

examples.en: Staff felt uncertain during the reorganizations, but communication helped.
examples.zh: 在重组期间员工感到不安，但良好的沟通有所帮助。

definition.en: Specific events or rounds of restructuring (often in business or government).
definition.zh: （常用于商业或政府）具体的一次或多次结构调整/改制行动。

examples.en: Three reorganizations in two years created confusion about roles.
examples.zh: 两年内三次重组让大家对职责分工感到困惑。

examples.en: The department is preparing for another reorganization next quarter.
examples.zh: 该部门正在为下个季度的再次改组做准备。

extraExplanation: “reorganizations”是复数形式，常见于职场语境，尤其指并购后、业务转型时对部门、汇报关系、岗位职责的调整。
搭配很常见：organizational reorganization（组织重组）、internal reorganization（内部重组）、major/minor reorganization（重大/小幅重组）。

summary.en: Reorganize means to arrange something again in a new, more effective way, or to change a group/system’s structure.
summary.zh: reorganize 指把某事重新整理/重组以更有效，或指团体/系统调整结构并重新组织。

definition.en: to arrange something again in a new, clearer, or more effective way (people, tasks, information, plans, etc.)
definition.zh: 把某事重新安排/重组，使之更清晰或更有效（人员、任务、信息、计划等）

examples.en: We need to reorganize the schedule so everyone can attend the meeting.
examples.zh: 我们需要重新安排日程，这样大家都能参加会议。

examples.en: She reorganized her notes by topic before the exam.
examples.zh: 考试前她按主题把笔记重新整理了一遍。

examples.en: The company reorganized its teams to improve communication.
examples.zh: 公司重组了团队以改善沟通。

definition.en: (of a group or system) to change its structure or arrangement; to become organized again
definition.zh: （团体或系统）调整结构/重新组织；重新变得有条理

examples.en: After the merger, the department reorganized into three smaller units.
examples.zh: 合并后，这个部门重组为三个更小的单位。

examples.en: The volunteers reorganized quickly after the sudden change of plans.
examples.zh: 计划突然改变后，志愿者们很快重新组织起来。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，与“organize（组织；整理）”结合形成“reorganize”。
美式拼写常见为 reorganize；英式拼写也常见 reorganise（-ise）。两者意思相同。
常用于工作与学习场景：reorganize a team/department（重组团队/部门）、reorganize files/notes（重新整理文件/笔记）、reorganize a plan/schedule（调整计划/日程）。

summary.en: “Reorganized” means arranged again in a new structure or order (often to improve efficiency).
summary.zh: “reorganized”表示“重新组织/改组/整理过”，常指为提升效率而调整结构或顺序。

definition.en: arranged again in a new way to make something work better or differently
definition.zh: 重新安排或改组，使事物以新的方式运作（通常为了更有效或不同）

examples.en: After the merger, the company was reorganized into three smaller teams.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司被重新组织成三个更小的团队。

examples.en: My notes are reorganized by topic, so they’re easier to review.
examples.zh: 我的笔记按主题重新整理过，所以更容易复习。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reorganize: to change the structure or order of something again
definition.zh: reorganize 的过去式/过去分词：再次改变某事物的结构或顺序

examples.en: We reorganized the schedule to reduce overtime.
examples.zh: 我们重新调整了日程安排，以减少加班。

examples.en: The library has reorganized its shelves by genre.
examples.zh: 图书馆已按体裁重新整理书架。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次/重新”，所以 reorganize 强调“把原本的组织结构再调整”。
美式英语常写 reorganize；英式英语常写 reorganise（-ize / -ise 的拼写差异，意思相同）。

summary.en: Reorganizer means a person or tool that reorganizes something into a new order or structure.
summary.zh: Reorganizer 指“重新组织/重整”的人或工具，把事物按新的顺序或结构整理。

definition.en: A person, group, or tool that reorganizes something (puts it into a new order or structure).
definition.zh: 对某事进行重新组织的人、团体或工具（把事物按新的顺序或结构整理）。

examples.en: She became the project’s reorganizer, redesigning the schedule and team roles.
examples.zh: 她成了这个项目的“重组者”，重新设计了进度表和团队分工。

examples.en: This app works as a photo reorganizer that sorts pictures by date and place.
examples.zh: 这个应用相当于照片整理工具，会按日期和地点给图片重新排序。

extraExplanation: “reorganizer”由 re-（再次）+ organize（组织）+ -er（做某事的人/工具）构成，常用于描述“负责把系统、团队、文件、信息重新整理的人”，也可指“用于重新整理的工具/软件”。
实际写作中更常见的表达有：a person who reorganizes… / a reorganization tool；当指人时也常用 organizer（组织者/筹办者），但 reorganizer 更强调“把原有东西重新组织”。

summary.en: Reorganizers are people, groups, or tools that reorganize something—arranging it again in a better or different way.
summary.zh: Reorganizers 指进行重新组织/重新安排的人、团体或工具，把事物以更好或不同的方式重新整理。

definition.en: People, groups, or tools that reorganize something (change its structure so it is arranged in a better or different way).
definition.zh: 对某事物进行“重新组织/重新安排”的人、团体或工具（把结构调整得更合理或不同）。

examples.en: The reorganizers created new teams to improve communication.
examples.zh: 重组人员建立了新团队，以改善沟通。

examples.en: After the merger, reorganizers reviewed every department’s roles.
examples.zh: 并购后，重组团队审查了每个部门的职责分工。

examples.en: Some file reorganizers can sort your documents automatically.
examples.zh: 一些文件整理工具可以自动对你的文档进行分类。

extraExplanation: “reorganizers”是“reorganizer”的复数。词形结构：re-（再次）+ organize（组织）+ -er（做……的人/工具）+ -s（复数）。因此既可指“重组的人/团队”，也可指“用来重组/整理的工具（如软件）”。
常见搭配：corporate reorganizers（企业重组人员/团队）、department reorganizers（部门重组者）、file/folder reorganizers（文件/文件夹整理工具）。

summary.en: “Reorganizes” means arranges something again or restructures a group/system to work better.
summary.zh: “reorganizes”表示把某事重新整理，或对团队/系统进行重组以更有效运作。

definition.en: to arrange something again in a new, clearer, or more effective way
definition.zh: 把某事物重新组织/重新安排，使其更清晰或更有效

examples.en: She reorganizes her notes before every exam.
examples.zh: 她每次考试前都会重新整理笔记。

examples.en: The manager reorganizes the team to improve communication.
examples.zh: 经理重新调整团队来改善沟通。

definition.en: to change the structure of a group, company, or system (for example, roles, departments, or rules)
definition.zh: 对团体、公司或系统进行重组（例如调整部门、职责或规则）

examples.en: The company reorganizes its departments after the merger.
examples.zh: 公司在合并后重组各个部门。

examples.en: The school reorganizes its schedule to give students more study time.
examples.zh: 学校重新安排课程表，让学生有更多自习时间。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，所以 reorganize = organize（组织）+ re-（重新）。
美式常见拼写是 organize / reorganize；英式常见拼写是 organise / reorganise。
“reorganizes”是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reorganizes）。如果说“正在重组”，常用 is reorganizing。

summary.en: Reorganizing means changing the arrangement or structure of something to create a better order; it can also mean the process of doing this.
summary.zh: reorganizing 指为了更好的秩序而重新调整安排或结构；也可指“重组/重新整理”的过程。

definition.en: changing the way something is arranged or structured so it works better; putting it into a new order
definition.zh: 重新调整……的安排或结构，使其更有效；重新排序

examples.en: We’re reorganizing the office so teams can sit together.
examples.zh: 我们正在重新调整办公室布局，让团队能坐在一起。

examples.en: She spent the weekend reorganizing her notes for the exam.
examples.zh: 她用周末时间重新整理了考试笔记。

examples.en: The company is reorganizing its departments to cut costs.
examples.zh: 公司正在重组各部门以降低成本。

definition.en: the process or act of reorganizing something
definition.zh: 重组；重新整理（这一过程或行为）

examples.en: After the reorganizing, communication became faster.
examples.zh: 重组之后，沟通变得更快了。

examples.en: The reorganizing of the library took two months.
examples.zh: 图书馆的重新整理花了两个月。

extraExplanation: reorganizing 来自动词 reorganize（re- “再次” + organize “组织/整理”）。英式拼写常见为 reorganise。
在职场语境里，reorganizing 常指“重组/改组”（如部门、流程）；在生活语境里更常指“整理收纳”（如房间、文件）。

summary.en: Reorient means to adjust direction or focus again, or to regain your sense of direction.
summary.zh: reorient 指“重新调整方向/重点”，也可指“重新辨明方向、重新适应”。

definition.en: To change the direction, position, or focus of something (or someone) so it is correctly aligned or aimed again.
definition.zh: 使（某物/某人）重新调整方向、位置或重点；重新对准。

examples.en: The guide helped us reorient the map so north was at the top.
examples.zh: 向导帮我们把地图重新调整方向，让北方在上面。

examples.en: After the merger, the company reoriented its strategy toward online services.
examples.zh: 合并后，公司把战略重点重新调整到线上服务。

definition.en: To become oriented again; to find your bearings after being confused or in a new place.
definition.zh: （自己）重新辨明方向；重新适应（陌生环境/新情况）。

examples.en: I got off at the wrong station and needed a minute to reorient.
examples.zh: 我在错误的车站下车了，需要一点时间重新辨明方向。

examples.en: After a short break, she reoriented and continued the presentation confidently.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，她重新理清思路，自信地继续演讲。

extraExplanation: 词根提示：orient 表示“使朝向东方/确定方向”，来自 “Orient（东方）”。后来引申为“熟悉环境、找到方位/定位重点”。re- 表示“再次”，所以 reorient 就是“再次定位/重新调整方向或重点”。
常见搭配：reorient yourself（让自己重新找准方向/状态）；reorient toward/to + 目标（把重点转向……）；reorientation（名词：重新定位/重新调整）。

summary.en: Reorientate means to turn something again to a new direction, or to refocus and adjust thinking/behavior to fit a new situation; it can also mean to regain your sense of place.
summary.zh: reorientate 指把某物重新调整到新的方向；也指重新聚焦、调整思维或做法以适应新情况；还可指重新找回方向感。

definition.en: to change the position or direction of something so it faces a new way; to turn or align again
definition.zh: 重新调整（某物）的方向或位置；使重新对准

examples.en: Please reorientate the map so north is at the top.
examples.zh: 请把地图重新摆正，让北方在上面。

examples.en: The engineer reorientated the camera toward the stage.
examples.zh: 工程师把摄像头重新对准舞台。

definition.en: to change how someone thinks or acts so they can adapt to a new situation; to refocus
definition.zh: 重新调整（思维/做法）以适应新情况；重新定位重点

examples.en: After the company changed goals, the team had to reorientate its strategy.
examples.zh: 公司更换目标后，团队不得不重新调整策略。

examples.en: Moving abroad forced her to reorientate her expectations.
examples.zh: 搬到国外迫使她重新调整自己的期待。

definition.en: to become familiar with a new place or situation again; to regain your sense of direction
definition.zh: （在新环境中）重新适应；重新找回方向感

examples.en: I got lost in the building and needed a minute to reorientate.
examples.zh: 我在楼里迷路了，需要一点时间重新辨认方向。

examples.en: After waking up, he paused to reorientate himself.
examples.zh: 醒来后，他停了一下让自己重新清醒并辨认环境。

extraExplanation: “reorientate”在英式英语中更常见；美式英语里更常用、更简洁的形式是“reorient”。两者意思相同。
词源结构：re-（再次）+ orient（定位/朝向）。既可指物理方向（地图、摄像头、身体），也可指抽象方向（目标、策略、思路）。

summary.en: Reorientated means redirected or adjusted to a new direction or focus (BrE spelling; AmE usually reoriented).
summary.zh: reorientated 指“重新定位/重新调整方向或重点”（英式拼写；美式更常用 reoriented）。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of reorientate) to change the direction, position, or focus of something so it faces or works in a new way.
definition.zh: （reorientate 的过去式/过去分词）使……重新定位；改变……的方向、立场或重点，使其朝向新的方向/方式。

examples.en: The company reorientated its strategy toward online sales.
examples.zh: 公司把战略重点重新调整到线上销售。

examples.en: After the merger, the team was reorientated to new goals and processes.
examples.zh: 并购后，团队被重新导向新的目标和流程。

definition.en: (adj.) having been redirected or adjusted to a new direction or purpose.
definition.zh: （形容词）已被重新定位/重新调整方向或目标的。

examples.en: She felt reorientated after a few days in the new job.
examples.zh: 在新工作适应了几天后，她感觉自己重新进入了状态。

examples.en: The reorientated program focuses more on student well-being.
examples.zh: 这个经过重新调整的项目更关注学生的身心健康。

extraExplanation: “reorientated”常见于英式英语；美式英语更常用拼写“reoriented”。两者意思相同。
词根提示：re-（再次）+ orient（使朝向/定位）。除了“方向”，也常指“工作重点/策略重心”的转移。

summary.en: “Reorientating” means turning something to a new direction or changing focus/strategy to a new direction.
summary.zh: “reorientating”指把某物转向新的方向，或把注意力/目标/策略重新调整到新的方向。

definition.en: changing the direction or position of something; turning it to face a new way
definition.zh: 改变某物的方向或位置；把它转向新的朝向

examples.en: The crew is reorientating the satellite so its solar panels face the sun.
examples.zh: 工作人员正在重新调整卫星的方向，让它的太阳能板对准太阳。

examples.en: She paused to reorientate the map and find north again.
examples.zh: 她停下来把地图重新转正，再次找到北方。

definition.en: changing the focus, goals, or way of thinking of a person, group, or plan
definition.zh: 改变个人/团队/计划的重点、目标或思路；重新调整方向

examples.en: After the budget cuts, the company is reorientating its strategy toward online services.
examples.zh: 预算削减后，公司正在把战略重新调整到线上服务。

examples.en: The workshop helped students reorientate their study habits.
examples.zh: 这次工作坊帮助学生重新调整学习习惯。

extraExplanation: “reorientating”是动词“reorientate”的现在分词/动名词形式（也常写作“reorienting”，更偏美式；“reorientating”更常见于英式英语）。
词根可拆为 re-（再次）+ orient（定向/定位，和“the Orient（东方）”同源：早期欧洲人用“向东方定位”来辨别方向）。因此它既可指“把物体转向”，也常引申为“把注意力/策略重新对准某个方向”。

summary.en: Reorientation means adjusting your direction or focus, or (in healthcare) helping someone regain awareness of time and place.
summary.zh: Reorientation 指重新调整方向/重心，或（在医疗照护中）帮助恢复对时间与地点等的辨识能力。

definition.en: the act or process of changing direction, position, or focus; adjusting to a new situation or environment
definition.zh: 重新定向；（对环境/目标的）重新调整与适应

examples.en: After moving to a new city, the first few weeks were a period of reorientation.
examples.zh: 搬到新城市后，最开始的几周是一段重新适应的时期。

examples.en: The therapist helped him with reorientation after the injury.
examples.zh: 治疗师帮助他在受伤后进行重新定向（重新适应与找回方向感）。

examples.en: The company’s reorientation toward renewable energy changed its long-term plans.
examples.zh: 公司将重心重新转向可再生能源，改变了长期规划。

definition.en: the restoration of someone’s sense of time, place, or identity (often in medical or care settings)
definition.zh: （常用于医疗/照护语境）帮助恢复对时间、地点或自我身份的辨识能力

examples.en: Nurses used gentle questions for reorientation: “Do you know what day it is?”
examples.zh: 护士用温和的问题来帮助重新定向：“你知道今天星期几吗？”

examples.en: Frequent reorientation can reduce anxiety in patients with dementia.
examples.zh: 经常进行重新定向能减轻失智症患者的焦虑。

extraExplanation: “reorientation”由 re-（再次）+ orientation（定向；方向感；适应）构成，常见于三类语境：①生活与学习：到新环境后的“适应期”；②工作与战略：组织“转向/调整方向”；③医疗照护：针对谵妄、失智或术后意识混乱的“定向力训练”。
常见搭配：a period of reorientation（重新适应期）；reorientation to/ toward…（转向/重新聚焦于……）；provide/offer reorientation（提供定向提示）；reorientation therapy（定向训练/定向疗法，常与现实导向 reality orientation 相关）。

summary.en: “Reorientations” means changes or adjustments in direction, focus, or viewpoint (plural of reorientation).
summary.zh: “reorientations”指在方向、重点或观点上的重新调整（reorientation 的复数）。

definition.en: Changes in direction, focus, or point of view; processes of turning again toward a new goal or way of thinking.
definition.zh: 方向、重点或观点的重新调整；把注意力或行动转向新目标/新思路的过程。

examples.en: After the merger, the company went through several reorientations to match the new market.
examples.zh: 合并后，公司经历了几次重新定位，以适应新市场。

examples.en: Moving to a new country often requires reorientations in daily habits and social norms.
examples.zh: 搬到新的国家通常需要在日常习惯和社会规范上做出重新适应与调整。

examples.en: Therapy can help with reorientations in how you see yourself and your relationships.
examples.zh: 心理咨询可以帮助你在自我认知和人际关系的看法上进行重新调整。

definition.en: (More specific) The act of helping someone regain their sense of direction or understanding after confusion or disruption.
definition.zh: （更具体）在迷失、混乱或遭遇变化后，帮助某人重新找回方向感或理解的行为。

examples.en: Clear signs in the airport allowed quick reorientations for travelers.
examples.zh: 机场清晰的指示牌让旅客能迅速重新辨明方向。

examples.en: The teacher’s summary provided a reorientation after the difficult reading.
examples.zh: 老师的总结在阅读难点之后起到了“重新理清思路”的作用。

extraExplanation: “reorientation”由 re-（再次、重新）+ orientation（方向、定位、取向）构成。既可指物理上的“重新定向”，也常见于商业（战略调整）、教育（学习方向调整）、心理与社会议题（价值观/身份认同的再定位）等语境。
常见搭配：strategic reorientation（战略重心调整）、policy reorientation（政策转向）、cultural reorientation（文化适应/再定位）。

summary.en: Reoriented means changed to a new direction or focus, or having found your direction again.
summary.zh: reoriented 指“重新定向/重新调整方向或重点”，也可指“重新找回方向感”。

definition.en: (of a person or thing) adjusted or turned to face a different direction, position, or focus; changed to a new orientation.
definition.zh: （人或事物）被重新调整到不同的方向、位置或关注重点；重新定向的。

examples.en: After getting lost, I looked at the map and felt reoriented.
examples.zh: 迷路之后，我看了地图，感觉自己重新找到了方向。

examples.en: The company became reoriented toward online sales.
examples.zh: 这家公司把重点重新转向了线上销售。

definition.en: past tense of “reorient”: to change direction or focus; to help someone find their direction again.
definition.zh: “reorient”的过去式：改变方向或重点；帮助某人重新辨明方向。

examples.en: The signs reoriented visitors toward the main entrance.
examples.zh: 这些指示牌把访客引导回正门方向。

examples.en: The new manager reoriented the team’s goals for the next quarter.
examples.zh: 新经理重新调整了团队下个季度的目标。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，与“orient”（定向、使适应）组合成“reorient”。在职场语境里常指“调整战略重点”（reorient toward…）；在空间语境里常指“重新辨别方向”。
美式英语里更常见拼写是 reorient / reoriented；英式英语中也常见 reorientate / reorientated。

summary.en: Reorienting means adjusting direction or shifting focus to fit a new situation.
summary.zh: reorienting 指重新调整方向，或把重心/策略转向以适应新情况。

definition.en: changing direction, position, or alignment so something faces a new way; adjusting so it points correctly again
definition.zh: 改变方向、位置或对齐方式，使某物转向新的方向；重新校准指向

examples.en: The pilot kept reorienting the plane toward the runway.
examples.zh: 飞行员不断把飞机重新调整方向对准跑道。

examples.en: After the map app froze, I restarted it and reoriented the screen to north.
examples.zh: 地图应用卡住后我重启了它，并把屏幕方向重新调整为朝北。

definition.en: changing your goals, priorities, or way of thinking to fit a new situation
definition.zh: 调整目标、优先事项或思维方式，以适应新情况

examples.en: The company is reorienting its strategy toward renewable energy.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在把战略重新调整为面向可再生能源。

examples.en: After moving abroad, she spent months reorienting herself to a new culture.
examples.zh: 搬到国外后，她花了几个月让自己重新适应一种新文化。

extraExplanation: “reorienting”是动词“reorient”的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（is reorienting）或作名词性用法（Reorienting takes time）。
既可指“物理方向”的重新定位，也常用于更抽象的“重心/策略/观念”的转向；商业、教育与心理适应语境里很常见。

summary.en: “Reorients” means “turns or adjusts again,” either physically (direction/position) or mentally/strategically (focus and priorities).
summary.zh: “Reorients”表示“重新调整/重新定向”，既可指物理方向位置的调整，也可指思路、重点或策略的重新定位。

definition.en: (third-person singular of reorient) to change direction or position so something faces a new way; to turn again.
definition.zh: （reorient 的第三人称单数）使（某物）改变方向或位置，重新朝向；再次转向。

examples.en: She reorients the map so north is at the top.
examples.zh: 她把地图重新摆正，让北方在上面。

examples.en: The camera automatically reorients when you rotate the phone.
examples.zh: 你转动手机时，相机会自动重新调整方向。

definition.en: (third-person singular of reorient) to change the focus, goals, or approach of a person, group, or plan; to shift priorities.
definition.zh: （reorient 的第三人称单数）重新调整（人/团队/计划）的重点、目标或方法；改变优先事项。

examples.en: After the market changed, the company reorients its strategy toward online sales.
examples.zh: 市场变化后，公司把战略重新调整到线上销售。

examples.en: The teacher reorients the discussion back to the main question.
examples.zh: 老师把讨论重新引回到核心问题。

definition.en: (third-person singular of reorient) to help someone regain their sense of direction or understanding after confusion.
definition.zh: （reorient 的第三人称单数）帮助某人在迷失/困惑后重新辨明方向或理清思路。

examples.en: A short break reorients him after a long meeting.
examples.zh: 短暂休息能让他在长会后重新理清思路。

examples.en: Clear signs reorient visitors who get lost in the building.
examples.zh: 清晰的标识能帮助在大楼里迷路的访客重新找到方向。

extraExplanation: “reorients”来自动词 reorient（re- + orient）。re- 表示“再次/重新”，orient 表示“定向、使朝向、使适应”。
拼写上常见 reorient 与 re-orient 两种形式；含义相同。英式写法里带连字符的版本更常见一些。
在商业与写作语境中，reorient 常指“调整重点/策略”，比“turn”更强调“为了适应新情况而改变方向”。

summary.en: Reornament means to decorate something again by adding new decorative details.
summary.zh: Reornament 指“再次装饰”，即重新添加装饰细节。

definition.en: to decorate again; to add new ornaments or decorative details to something that has been decorated before
definition.zh: 再次装饰；重新加上装饰物或装饰细节

examples.en: After the renovation, they reornamented the hall with simple lights and fresh flowers.
examples.zh: 翻新后，他们用简洁的灯光和鲜花重新装饰了大厅。

examples.en: The designer decided to reornament the dress with a new lace collar.
examples.zh: 设计师决定给这条裙子重新加上新的蕾丝领。

extraExplanation: “reornament”由 re-（再次、重新）+ ornament（装饰）构成，但在现代英语里非常少见。日常更常用的说法是 “decorate again / redecorate / re-embellish”。
在艺术修复、建筑翻新或服装改造的语境中，这个词更容易出现，用来强调“原本就有装饰→后来改动→现在又重新加装饰”。

summary.en: “reotene” isn’t standard English; you probably mean “routine.”
summary.zh: “reotene”不是标准英文；你很可能想写“routine（惯例/日常流程）”。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling of “routine” (a regular way of doing things).
definition.zh: 不是标准英文单词。很可能是“routine”的拼写错误（指做事的固定方式、日常惯例）。

examples.en: Did you mean “routine”? I have a morning routine: coffee, shower, then work.
examples.zh: 你是不是想写“routine”？我有一个早晨的日常：咖啡、洗澡，然后上班。

examples.en: Exercise became part of her daily routine.
examples.zh: 锻炼成了她日常生活的一部分。

extraExplanation: “reotene”在常见英语词典中一般查不到。如果你想表达“日常惯例/固定流程”，最常用的是 routine。
如果你指的是科学名词，也可能想写“retene”（一种多环芳香烃，常见于地球化学/燃烧产物相关语境），但这属于专业词汇。你可以告诉我你看到它的句子或领域，我可以帮你确认。

summary.en: Reoutfit means to dress again or provide a new outfit.
summary.zh: Reoutfit 指重新穿戴或再次配备一套新服装。

definition.en: to dress someone (or yourself) in new clothes, or to provide a new outfit again
definition.zh: （给某人或自己）重新穿戴、换上一套新的衣服；再次配备服装

examples.en: We had to reoutfit the actors after the costumes got wet.
examples.zh: 戏服弄湿后，我们不得不给演员们重新换装。

examples.en: She reoutfitted herself for the evening event.
examples.zh: 她为晚上的活动重新换了一身衣服。

examples.en: The company reoutfitted the team with winter jackets.
examples.zh: 公司为团队重新配发了冬季外套。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加在“outfit”（给…配备服装；装备）前形成动词“reoutfit”。它在日常口语中不算常见，更常见的表达是“change outfits / get changed / refit / re-equip / re-dress（更偏舞台/儿童）”，但在戏剧、电影制作、零售、团队制服等语境里更自然。

summary.en: Reoutfitted means “equipped again,” usually with updated gear or features.
summary.zh: reoutfitted 指“重新配备/再次装备”，通常带有升级或更新之意。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle) outfitted again; equipped again, often with new or updated gear, clothing, or parts.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）再次配备；重新装备（常指换上新的或升级的装备、衣物或部件）。

examples.en: The hiking team reoutfitted the older members with lighter backpacks.
examples.zh: 徒步队给年长队员重新配备了更轻的背包。

examples.en: After the renovation, the restaurant was reoutfitted with modern lighting and new chairs.
examples.zh: 翻新后，这家餐厅重新配备了现代灯具和新椅子。

examples.en: The company reoutfitted its delivery vans to run on electricity.
examples.zh: 公司把送货车重新改装为电动。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle, less common) dressed again or provided with a new set of clothes.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词，较少见）重新穿戴；重新给（某人）置办衣物。

examples.en: The costumes were cleaned and reoutfitted for the next performance.
examples.zh: 戏服清洗后又重新整理配备，用于下一场演出。

extraExplanation: “reoutfitted”来自前缀 re-（再次、重新）+ outfit（为……配备/装备）。常见于新闻、商业、工程与户外语境，强调“升级、改装、重新配置”。
在美式英语里，outfit 作动词时很常见（outfit a team / outfit a room），加上 re- 就表示“再一次装备/配置”，语气偏正式。

summary.en: Reoutfitting means equipping something again or upgrading it with new items or parts.
summary.zh: Reoutfitting 指对某物重新装备或用新物品/部件进行升级改装。

definition.en: the act of equipping something again, or giving it new equipment, clothing, or parts (often to update, repair, or prepare for a new use)
definition.zh: 重新配置/装备（某物）；重新换装、更新设备或部件（常为升级、修复或适应新用途）

examples.en: The navy is reoutfitting the ship with new radar and safety systems.
examples.zh: 海军正在为这艘船重新配置新的雷达和安全系统。

examples.en: Reoutfitting the office for hybrid work took several weeks.
examples.zh: 为了适应混合办公，重新布置并更新办公室设备花了好几周。

definition.en: (present participle of reoutfit) equipping something again or with new items
definition.zh: （reoutfit 的现在分词）正在重新装备/换装；用新物品再次配备

examples.en: They are reoutfitting the old bus to turn it into a mobile library.
examples.zh: 他们正在把那辆旧巴士重新改装成一座移动图书馆。

examples.en: She’s reoutfitting her hiking kit before the next trip.
examples.zh: 她在下次旅行前正在把徒步装备重新补齐并更新。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，outfit表示“装备、配备（衣物或器材）”。因此 reoutfit 常用于“船只/车辆/房屋/办公室/团队”等的升级改装或重新配备。
拼写上有时也可见作 re-outfitting（加连字符），尤其在标题或正式写作中。

summary.en: “Reoutline” means to outline something again, usually to reorganize its structure more clearly.
summary.zh: “reoutline”表示把内容重新拟大纲/重组结构，使其更清晰。

definition.en: to make an outline again; to revise the structure/plan of a piece of writing, a presentation, or a project
definition.zh: 重新拟大纲；重新梳理（文章、演讲或项目）的结构/计划

examples.en: After getting feedback, I reoutlined my essay to make the main argument clearer.
examples.zh: 收到反馈后，我重新拟了文章大纲，让中心论点更清楚。

examples.en: Let’s reoutline the presentation so the timeline comes before the results.
examples.zh: 我们把演示重新梳理一下结构，让时间线放在结果之前。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次/重新”，outline 指“提纲、轮廓”。reoutline 常见于写作与项目管理语境，强调把结构重新安排，而不只是改几个句子。

summary.en: “Reoutlined” means you made an outline again or reorganized the main points.
summary.zh: “reoutlined”表示你重新列了提纲，或把主要要点重新整理了一遍。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reoutline”: to make a new outline of something, or to organize the main points again (often more clearly).
definition.zh: “reoutline”的过去式/过去分词：为某事重新列提纲；把主要要点重新整理（通常更清晰）。

examples.en: After the teacher’s feedback, I reoutlined my essay to improve the structure.
examples.zh: 根据老师的反馈，我重新列了文章的提纲来改善结构。

examples.en: We reoutlined the presentation so the key points came first.
examples.zh: 我们重新整理了演示的提纲，让关键点放在最前面。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，outline 作动词时是“概述、列提纲”。所以 reoutline 常用于写作、报告、项目计划等场景，强调“重新组织要点”，不一定表示内容完全改变，而是结构与重点的调整。
在学术写作中，reoutline 往往发生在收到反馈（feedback）后：先抓论点与段落逻辑，再回头改句子细节。

summary.en: Reoutlining means making an outline again to reorganize or clarify ideas.
summary.zh: reoutlining 指“重新列大纲”，用来重组结构或让思路更清晰。

definition.en: the act of making an outline again, often to reorganize or clarify a plan, document, or piece of writing
definition.zh: 重新列大纲（再次拟定提纲），通常为了重组结构或让计划、文件、文章更清晰

examples.en: After the teacher’s feedback, I spent an hour reoutlining my essay.
examples.zh: 根据老师的反馈，我花了一个小时重新给文章列大纲。

examples.en: Reoutlining the presentation helped us see the main message more clearly.
examples.zh: 重新整理演示的大纲让我们更清楚地看到核心信息。

definition.en: revising the outline of something; outlining it again
definition.zh: 再次为某事拟定提纲；重做结构框架

examples.en: She is reoutlining the report to match the new requirements.
examples.zh: 她正在重新整理报告的大纲，以符合新要求。

examples.en: We kept reoutlining until the chapters flowed naturally.
examples.zh: 我们不断重列大纲，直到各章衔接自然。

extraExplanation: “reoutlining”常见于写作与项目管理语境：当主题、受众或要求变化时，先“reoutline（重列大纲）”能更快发现结构问题，比如重点不突出、顺序不合理或论据重复。也常与“reorganize / restructure / revise the outline”互换使用，但“reoutlining”更强调“回到大纲层面重新规划”。

summary.en: Tell me which word/phrase (or paste the previous content) you want re-output.
summary.zh: 請告訴我你要重新輸出的單字／片語（或貼上先前內容）。

definition.en: I need the word or phrase you want me to re-output (and if you want any changes, like simpler definitions or more examples).
definition.zh: 我需要你想要我重新輸出的單字或片語（如果你也想調整內容，例如更簡單的解釋或更多例句，也請告訴我）。

examples.en: Please tell me the word you mean, e.g., “reoutput.”
examples.zh: 請告訴我你指的是哪個詞，例如「reoutput」。

examples.en: If you want me to re-output the last entry, paste it here.
examples.zh: 如果你想我重新輸出上一個詞條，請把它貼在這裡。

summary.en: “Reoutrage” is a rare way to say “outrage again,” meaning to cause renewed anger or shock.
summary.zh: “reoutrage”较少见，用来表示“再次激起愤怒/震惊”，即引发新一轮不满或公愤。

definition.en: (rare, nonstandard) To outrage again; to make people angry or shocked again, especially by repeating an offensive act or reopening a painful issue.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）再次激起愤怒或震惊；尤指重复冒犯行为或重新揭开令人痛苦的事件，从而让公众“再度被激怒”。

examples.en: The new video could reoutrage viewers who were already upset last year.
examples.zh: 这段新视频可能会让去年就已经很不满的观众再次被激怒。

examples.en: Bringing up the scandal during the ceremony may reoutrage the victim’s family.
examples.zh: 在仪式上提起那场丑闻，可能会再次激怒受害者家属。

extraExplanation: “reoutrage”并不是常见的标准词汇，多数情况下更自然的表达是：reignite outrage（重新点燃愤怒）、spark outrage again（再次引发公愤）、cause renewed outrage（造成新一轮愤怒/公愤）。
构词上可以理解为 re-（再、重新）+ outrage（激怒/公愤）。在新闻或评论写作里，常用名词搭配：renewed outrage（新一轮公愤）、public outrage（公众愤怒）。

summary.en: “Reovercharge” means to overcharge again—either charging someone too much again or overcharging a battery again.
summary.zh: “reovercharge”指“再次过度收费/再次多收费”，也可指“再次过度充电”。

definition.en: to charge (a customer) too much again; to overcharge again after already doing so
definition.zh: 再次多收费用；在已收费过高的基础上又一次多收费

examples.en: The customer complained that the hotel reovercharged her for the minibar items.
examples.zh: 那位顾客抱怨酒店在迷你吧物品上又一次多收了她的钱。

examples.en: Please double-check the invoice so we don’t reovercharge anyone.
examples.zh: 请再核对一下发票，避免我们再次多收任何人的费用。

definition.en: to overcharge (a battery or device) again, usually by charging past safe limits a second time
definition.zh: 再次过度充电（对电池或设备）；通常指第二次把电充过头、超过安全范围

examples.en: If you reovercharge a lithium battery, it can overheat and become dangerous.
examples.zh: 如果你让锂电池再次过度充电，它可能会过热并变得危险。

examples.en: The manual warns users not to reovercharge the device after a full charge.
examples.zh: 说明书警告用户在充满电后不要再次过度充电。

extraExplanation: “reovercharge”不是很常见的标准词，实际写作中更常见的是带连字符的“re-overcharge”，或改用更自然的表达，如“overcharge again / charge again at an inflated price”。
在电池语境里，人们更常说“overcharge (the battery) again”或直接用“overcharge”。若讨论安全与技术说明，建议用更清晰的说法（例如：avoid overcharging; do not charge beyond the rated limit）。

summary.en: “reoverflow” is a rare/nonstandard word meaning “to overflow again” or “a second overflow.”
summary.zh: “reoverflow”较少见、偏非标准，表示“再次溢出”或“第二次溢出（事件）”。

definition.en: (rare / nonstandard) to overflow again; to spill over a second time after being controlled or reduced.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）再次溢出；在已被控制或减少后又第二次外溢。

examples.en: After the storm, the river reoverflowed and flooded the fields again.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，河水再次溢出，又淹没了田地。

examples.en: If the tank is refilled too quickly, it may reoverflow.
examples.zh: 如果水箱回填得太快，可能会再次溢出。

definition.en: (rare) a second overflow event; another instance of spilling over.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次溢出（的事件）；第二次外溢的情况。

examples.en: Engineers redesigned the drain to prevent a reoverflow.
examples.zh: 工程师重新设计了排水系统，以防再次溢流。

extraExplanation: “reoverflow”不是常见英语词，更多时候人们会说“overflow again / overflowed again（再次溢出）”或“a second overflow（第二次溢出）”。
在计算机语境里，人们通常说“buffer overflow（缓冲区溢出）”“stack overflow（栈溢出）”。如果想表达“再次发生溢出”，更自然的说法是“overflow again”或“another overflow”。

summary.en: “Reovertake” means to pass someone again and regain the lead.
summary.zh: “Reovertake”指在被超过后再次反超，重新领先。

definition.en: to overtake someone or something again after being passed or losing the lead
definition.zh: （在被超过或失去领先后）再次超过（某人/某物），重新夺回领先

examples.en: After the pit stop, she managed to reovertake her rival on the next lap.
examples.zh: 进站之后，她在下一圈设法再次超过了对手。

examples.en: The faster train slowed down at a station, but it later reovertook the local train.
examples.zh: 那趟更快的列车在车站减速了，但后来又再次超过了慢车。

examples.en: Our team fell behind early, then reovertook the lead in the final minutes.
examples.zh: 我们队一开始落后，但在最后几分钟重新夺回了领先。

extraExplanation: “reovertake”由前缀 re-（再次）+ overtake（超过）组成，常见于赛车、骑行、跑步等“你追我赶”的语境。
在正式写作中，有时也会用更自然的表达替代，如 “overtake again / regain the lead / retake the lead”。

summary.en: “Reoverwork” means to overwork again—making someone (or yourself) work too much after a break or recovery.
summary.zh: “Reoverwork”表示“再次过度工作/再次让……过劳”，常指休息或恢复后又把工作量推得过大。

definition.en: to make someone work too much again; to overwork again after a rest or recovery
definition.zh: （再次）让……过度工作；让……在休息或恢复后又过劳

examples.en: After a short break, the manager reoverworked the team to meet the deadline.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，经理又让团队过度加班来赶截止日期。

examples.en: Be careful not to reoverwork your shoulder after the injury.
examples.zh: 受伤后要小心，别让肩膀再次过度劳累。

definition.en: to work too much again (often used when talking about your own workload)
definition.zh: （再次）过度工作；又把自己累过头（常用于谈自己的工作量）

examples.en: I promised myself I wouldn’t reoverwork, but I took on three new projects.
examples.zh: 我答应自己不再过度工作，但还是接了三个新项目。

extraExplanation: “reoverwork”不是很常见，更常见的表达是“overwork again”或“work myself too hard again”。写作时也常写成“re-overwork”（加连字符）来让结构更清晰。

summary.en: A reovirus is a double-stranded RNA virus that commonly infects humans and animals, often with mild or no symptoms.
summary.zh: reovirus（呼肠孤病毒）是一类双链RNA病毒，可感染人类与动物，常见为轻微或无症状感染。

definition.en: a virus with a double-stranded RNA genome that commonly infects humans and many animals, usually causing mild or no illness; the name comes from “respiratory enteric orphan” because early strains were found in the airways and intestines and were not clearly linked to disease
definition.zh: 呼肠孤病毒；一种双链RNA病毒，可感染人类及多种动物，通常导致轻微或无症状感染；名称源自“respiratory enteric orphan（呼吸道-肠道-孤儿）”，指早期发现于呼吸道和肠道，但当时未明确与疾病相关

examples.en: Reoviruses are often found in the respiratory tract or intestines and may not cause serious symptoms.
examples.zh: 呼肠孤病毒常见于呼吸道或肠道，可能不会引起严重症状。

examples.en: Some researchers study reovirus because it can be used in experiments to understand how viruses enter cells.
examples.zh: 一些研究者研究呼肠孤病毒，因为它可用于实验，帮助理解病毒如何进入细胞。

examples.en: In rare cases, certain reoviruses can be linked to disease in animals.
examples.zh: 在少数情况下，某些呼肠孤病毒可能与动物疾病有关。

extraExplanation: “reovirus”一词源自缩写：REO = respiratory（呼吸道） + enteric（肠道） + orphan（“孤儿”，指当时未能与特定疾病对应）。后来发现它们确实能引起感染，但在人类中多较轻或不典型。
读音中常见的分段是“REE-oh-VY-rus”。在科普或医学语境里，reovirus既可泛指“呼肠孤病毒”这类病毒，也常特指其代表种（如 mammalian orthoreovirus）。

summary.en: Reoviruses are a group of double‑stranded RNA viruses; some infect humans and animals and may cause mild respiratory or intestinal illness.
summary.zh: 呼肠孤病毒是一类含双链RNA的病毒；可感染人和动物，可能引起轻微的呼吸道或肠道症状。

definition.en: a group of viruses (family Reoviridae) that contain double‑stranded RNA; some infect humans and animals and can cause mild respiratory or intestinal illness, though many infections cause few or no symptoms
definition.zh: 呼肠孤病毒（呼肠孤病毒科）的一类病毒，含双链RNA；可感染人和动物，有时引起轻微的呼吸道或肠道症状，但很多感染可能无明显症状

examples.en: Reoviruses can spread through the fecal–oral route, especially in settings with poor hygiene.
examples.zh: 呼肠孤病毒可能通过粪—口途径传播，尤其在卫生条件较差的环境中。

examples.en: In the lab, scientists study reoviruses to understand how double‑stranded RNA viruses replicate.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，科学家研究呼肠孤病毒，以了解双链RNA病毒如何复制。

examples.en: Some reoviruses infect animals and may cause diarrhea in young livestock.
examples.zh: 一些呼肠孤病毒会感染动物，可能导致幼龄家畜腹泻。

extraExplanation: “reovirus”一词来自缩写：respiratory + enteric + orphan（最初在呼吸道和肠道中发现、但一度未与明确疾病对应的“孤儿”病毒）。
在医学与科研语境中也常见到“Reoviridae（呼肠孤病毒科）”“reovirus infection（呼肠孤病毒感染）”等搭配；有些成员（如轮状病毒 rotavirus）与腹泻相关，但“reovirus”本身常指另一支系的呼肠孤病毒。

summary.en: Reown means to own something again or to accept something as yours again.
summary.zh: reown 指“重新拥有（财物）”或“重新承认/承担（责任、身份等）”。

definition.en: to own something again, especially after losing it or giving it up; to regain ownership of
definition.zh: 重新拥有；（尤指失去或放弃后）再度取得……的所有权

examples.en: After paying off the loan, she could reown the car in her own name.
examples.zh: 还清贷款后，她就能以自己的名义重新拥有那辆车。

examples.en: The museum hopes to reown the artifact that was stolen decades ago.
examples.zh: 博物馆希望重新取得那件几十年前被盗文物的所有权。

definition.en: to publicly accept something as one’s own again (such as a responsibility, decision, or identity)
definition.zh: 重新认同并承担（责任/决定/身份等）；再次“把……当作自己的”

examples.en: He apologized and reowned his earlier mistake.
examples.zh: 他道歉并重新承认自己先前的错误。

examples.en: She decided to reown her background and speak proudly about it.
examples.zh: 她决定重新拥抱自己的出身，并自豪地谈起它。

extraExplanation: “reown”在日常英语里相对少见，更常见的表达是“own again / regain ownership of / take back ownership of”。写作中也常见带连字符的形式“re-own”，更清楚地表示“再次拥有”。
在法律或财产语境（房产、车辆、文物归还）里，“reown”容易让人联想到“恢复所有权”的概念；如果需要更正式，可以用“reacquire”或“recover (legal) ownership”。

summary.en: Reoxidation means being oxidized again, especially in chemical, battery, or corrosion processes.
summary.zh: reoxidation 指“再氧化”，常用于化学反应、电池过程或腐蚀等语境中。

definition.en: the process in which something is oxidized again (for example, after it has been reduced), often involving loss of electrons or gain of oxygen
definition.zh: 再氧化；重新被氧化的过程（例如在被还原之后再次发生氧化），通常涉及失去电子或与氧结合

examples.en: During cycling in the battery, reoxidation of the electrode material can reduce performance over time.
examples.zh: 在电池的充放电循环中，电极材料的再氧化可能会随着时间推移降低性能。

examples.en: The catalyst is regenerated by reoxidation in the presence of oxygen.
examples.zh: 该催化剂在氧气存在下通过再氧化得以再生。

examples.en: To prevent reoxidation of the metal surface, the parts were stored in a dry, inert environment.
examples.zh: 为防止金属表面再氧化，这些零件被存放在干燥的惰性环境中。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”，因此 reoxidation 字面意思就是“再一次氧化”。它常见于电化学（电池与电极反应）、催化反应循环、金属腐蚀与表面处理等语境中。
在氧化还原反应里，reoxidation 常与 “reduction（还原）”成对出现：某物先被还原，之后在氧气或其他氧化剂作用下再次被氧化。

summary.en: Reoxidise means to oxidize again—often returning something to an oxidized state after it was reduced.
summary.zh: Reoxidise 指“再氧化”，常用于指物质在被还原后再次回到氧化态。

definition.en: to oxidize again; to cause something to regain oxygen or lose electrons again (often after it was reduced).
definition.zh: 再氧化；使（物质）再次发生氧化反应（常指被还原后再次失去电子或重新与氧结合）。

examples.en: After the metal was cleaned, it began to reoxidise in the air.
examples.zh: 金属清洁后，在空气中又开始再氧化。

examples.en: The catalyst helps the compound reoxidise during the reaction cycle.
examples.zh: 催化剂帮助该化合物在反应循环中再氧化。

definition.en: (in industry/biology) to restore an oxidized state again so a substance can be reused or continue working.
definition.zh: （工业/生物语境）使恢复到氧化态，以便物质可再利用或继续发挥作用。

examples.en: Engineers reoxidise the material to regenerate the filter.
examples.zh: 工程师通过再氧化该材料来再生过滤器。

examples.en: Cells reoxidise NADH to NAD+ to keep metabolism running.
examples.zh: 细胞把 NADH 再氧化成 NAD+，以维持代谢进行。

extraExplanation: “reoxidise”是英式拼写；美式拼写更常见的是“reoxidize”。两者意思完全相同，只是 -ise / -ize 的地区差异。
在化学里，“氧化”不一定意味着“加氧”，更常指“失去电子/氧化态升高”；因此“reoxidise”常见于氧化还原循环（如催化、代谢）中。

summary.en: Reoxidised means “oxidized again,” and is also the past form of reoxidise.
summary.zh: reoxidised 意为“再次被氧化的”，也可作 reoxidise 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: oxidized again (after being reduced or after a first oxidation), often forming oxides once more
definition.zh: 再次被氧化的（在被还原或首次氧化之后又重新发生氧化），常指再次形成氧化物

examples.en: After heating in air, the metal surface became reoxidised.
examples.zh: 在空气中加热后，金属表面再次被氧化了。

examples.en: The pigment was reduced during processing and later reoxidised, changing its color.
examples.zh: 该颜料在加工过程中被还原，之后又重新氧化，颜色随之改变。

definition.en: past form of “reoxidise”: to oxidize something again
definition.zh: “reoxidise”的过去式/过去分词：使（某物）再次氧化

examples.en: They reoxidised the catalyst to restore its activity.
examples.zh: 他们让催化剂重新氧化，以恢复其活性。

examples.en: The material was reoxidised under controlled conditions.
examples.zh: 该材料在受控条件下被重新氧化。

extraExplanation: “reoxidised”是英式拼写；美式常写作“reoxidized”。两者意思相同，多见于化学、材料科学与电化学语境（如金属表面、催化剂、染料/颜料、氧化还原循环）。
词形拆解：re-（再次）+ oxidise/oxidize（氧化）+ -ed（过去分词/形容词用法）。在论文里常用作被动语态或形容词：was reoxidised / reoxidised surface。

summary.en: “Reoxidising” means oxidizing again or becoming oxidized again, especially in scientific contexts.
summary.zh: “reoxidising”表示再次氧化或重新被氧化，尤其常用于科学语境。

definition.en: oxidizing again; undergoing oxidation a second time (often in chemistry or metallurgy).
definition.zh: 再次氧化的；重新发生氧化反应的（常见于化学或冶金语境）。

examples.en: The copper surface is reoxidising after we cleaned it.
examples.zh: 我们清洁过后，铜表面又在重新氧化。

examples.en: Reoxidising can reduce the quality of the finished metal.
examples.zh: 重新氧化可能会降低成品金属的质量。

definition.en: the process of oxidizing something again; the present participle of “reoxidise/reoxidize.”
definition.zh: 再次使……氧化；“reoxidise/reoxidize”的现在分词形式，也可指重新氧化这一过程。

examples.en: Heating the sample in air is reoxidising the compounds.
examples.zh: 在空气中加热样品会让这些化合物再次氧化。

examples.en: They avoided reoxidising the material by storing it under nitrogen.
examples.zh: 他们把材料放在氮气环境中保存，以避免再次氧化。

extraExplanation: “reoxidising”是英式拼写；美式更常写作“reoxidizing”。意思相同。
在氧化还原（redox）语境里，reoxidise通常指某物先被还原（gain electrons，失去氧），之后又被氧化（lose electrons，得到氧/失去电子）。在材料、催化、电化学等领域很常见。

summary.en: Reoxidize means to oxidize again, especially after a substance has been reduced.
summary.zh: reoxidize 指“再次氧化”，尤其是指物质在被还原之后又重新氧化。

definition.en: to oxidize again; to restore oxygen to a substance after it has been reduced (lost oxygen or gained electrons)
definition.zh: 再氧化；使（已被还原的物质）再次氧化，重新与氧结合（或失去电子）

examples.en: After the metal surface was reduced in the furnace, it began to reoxidize when exposed to air.
examples.zh: 金属表面在炉内被还原后，一接触空气就开始再氧化。

examples.en: Chemists try to prevent the catalyst from reoxidizing during storage.
examples.zh: 化学家会尽量防止催化剂在储存过程中再氧化。

extraExplanation: 在化学与材料科学中，“reoxidize”常用于描述：还原环境（如氢气、真空、高温）处理后的金属或氧化物，一旦回到含氧环境（空气、氧气、水蒸气）就“回氧化”。
相关概念：oxidize（氧化）、reduce（还原）、reduction/oxidation（氧化还原反应）。有时也会写作 re-oxidize。

summary.en: Reoxidized means “oxidized again,” often after being reduced, or it can describe something that has been oxidized again.
summary.zh: reoxidized 表示“再次被氧化”，常指在被还原之后又重新氧化；也可作形容词表示“再次氧化过的”。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of reoxidize) to oxidize again, usually after something was previously reduced (gained electrons) or had its oxidation reversed.
definition.zh: （reoxidize 的过去式/过去分词）再次氧化；通常指某物先被还原（得到电子）或氧化状态被逆转后，又重新发生氧化。

examples.en: After the solution was exposed to air, the reduced metal ions reoxidized quickly.
examples.zh: 溶液暴露在空气中后，被还原的金属离子很快又被重新氧化。

examples.en: The catalyst was reduced during the reaction and then reoxidized in the next step.
examples.zh: 催化剂在反应中被还原，然后在下一步又被重新氧化。

definition.en: Describing a substance/material that has been oxidized again.
definition.zh: （作形容词）指某种物质/材料已再次被氧化的。

examples.en: The reoxidized surface showed a darker color.
examples.zh: 再次氧化后的表面颜色更深。

examples.en: They compared the reoxidized sample with the freshly prepared one.
examples.zh: 他们把再次氧化的样品与新制备的样品进行了对比。

extraExplanation: “reoxidize / reoxidized”常见于化学、电化学与材料科学语境，尤其在“氧化-还原循环（redox cycle）”里：物质在不同步骤中反复被还原与再氧化。
前缀 re- 表示“再次”。如果你在论文里写作，常与“reduced（被还原的）/ oxidized（被氧化的）/ reoxidation（再氧化）/ oxidation state（氧化态）”等搭配出现。

summary.en: Reoxidizing means oxidizing again or becoming oxidized again.
summary.zh: reoxidizing 指“再次氧化”或“重新被氧化”。

definition.en: to oxidize again; to make something undergo oxidation again after it was reduced or previously oxidized
definition.zh: 再次氧化；使（物质）在还原或先前氧化之后重新发生氧化反应

examples.en: After the catalyst was reduced, the technician reoxidized it to restore its activity.
examples.zh: 催化剂被还原后，技术员将其再氧化，以恢复活性。

examples.en: Be careful: heating the metal in air can reoxidize the surface.
examples.zh: 小心：在空气中加热金属会使表面再次氧化。

definition.en: (of a substance) undergoing oxidation again
definition.zh: （物质）再次被氧化；重新发生氧化过程

examples.en: The sample was reoxidizing during storage because oxygen leaked into the container.
examples.zh: 由于氧气渗入容器，样品在储存期间正在再氧化。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，因此 reoxidize = oxidize again。常见于化学、材料科学与电化学语境：例如金属表面形成氧化层、催化剂在“还原—再氧化”循环中调节活性。
在实验记录里，reoxidizing 常作为现在分词使用：描述正在发生的过程（The material is reoxidizing）或作定语（a reoxidizing surface）。

summary.en: Reoxygenate means to add oxygen again or restore oxygen levels (in water, blood, or tissues).
summary.zh: reoxygenate 指再次补充氧气或恢复氧含量（常用于水体、血液或组织）。

definition.en: to add oxygen to something again; to restore oxygen levels
definition.zh: （再）给……补充氧气；使……重新含氧/恢复氧含量

examples.en: The lake was reoxygenated to help fish survive the summer heat.
examples.zh: 为了帮助鱼类熬过夏季高温，湖水被重新补充了氧气。

examples.en: In the hospital, the team worked to reoxygenate the patient’s blood.
examples.zh: 在医院里，医疗团队努力让病人的血液重新获得足够的氧气。

definition.en: to become oxygenated again; to regain oxygen
definition.zh: 重新含氧；恢复氧气含量

examples.en: After the storm, the surface water began to reoxygenate.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，表层水开始重新含氧。

examples.en: Once the blockage was removed, the tissue slowly reoxygenated.
examples.zh: 一旦阻塞被清除，组织就会慢慢重新获得氧气。

extraExplanation: 常见于环境科学与医学语境：如“水体复氧”（改善缺氧水域）、“组织/血液再氧合”（缺氧后恢复供氧）。
构词上是 re-（再次）+ oxygenate（使含氧、供氧），因此含义直观，多用于技术或正式表达。

summary.en: Reoxygenize means to add oxygen again or restore oxygen levels.
summary.zh: Reoxygenize 指“重新供氧/恢复含氧量”。

definition.en: to add oxygen again; to restore oxygen to something (especially water, blood, or a closed space).
definition.zh: 再次供氧；重新为某物补充氧气（尤指水体、血液或密闭空间）。

examples.en: Engineers reoxygenized the lake to help fish survive after the algae bloom.
examples.zh: 工程师给湖水重新供氧，帮助鱼类在藻华之后存活。

examples.en: After the shutdown, the system was cleaned and reoxygenized before restarting.
examples.zh: 停机后，系统在重启前被清洁并重新供氧。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，“oxygen”是“氧气”，“-ize”表示“使……化/使成为……”。因此 reoxygenize 直译就是“使重新含氧”。
这个词多见于环境科学/水产养殖/工程语境（如给水体增氧、恢复处理系统的含氧量），日常口语里更常说 “add oxygen back” 或 “re-aerate”。
